column1: All antacids work equally well, but they can cause different side effects.
Antacids are a good treatment for heartburn that occurs once in awhile.
Antacids cannot treat more serious problems, such as appendicitis, a stomach ulcer, gallstones, or bowel problems.

Talk to your provider if you have: - Pain or symptoms that do not get better with antacids - Symptoms every day or at night - Nausea and vomiting - Bleeding in your bowel movements or darkened bowel movements - Bloating or cramping - Pain in your lower belly, on your side, or in your back - Diarrhea that is severe or does not go away - Fever with your belly pain - Chest pain or shortness of breath - Trouble swallowing - Weight loss that you cannot explain Call your provider if you need to use antacids on most days.
- Brands with magnesium may cause diarrhea.
- Brands with calcium or aluminum may cause constipation.
- Rarely, brands with calcium may cause kidney stones or other problems.
- If you take large amounts of antacids that contain aluminum, you may be at risk for calcium loss, which can lead to weak bones (osteoporosis).
Talk to your provider or pharmacist before taking antacids on a regular basis if: - You have kidney disease, high blood pressure, or heart disease.
